all the premium ones are gone
testing my mono-green life deck finally and it's actually good on a casual level. 108/108 [[ageless entity]]

text: I think we've discussed it before. Two mana ramp in nongreen is pretty good so they probably don't have much desire to finish them in a standard set. I would have liked to see them in the 2015 product, I guess, but they only get so many new designs for those products
Ok, but they have plenty of other supplemental product where they can print them. EDH or Conspiracy, etc.

Right, I meant the 2015 EDH product. They only get 40-50 new designs for those sets so they tend to keep them to weird and kooky designs they think will be fun. Vindictive Lich and orzhov advokist, weird multiplayer stuff.
I suppose, I suppose.
Conspiracy it just doesn't seem like a high priority. I dunno. It's not a gap they feel is important to fill. They like keeping us in suspense.
Then perhaps they need to create an 'EDH Core Set' :wink:

I think them skipping them over in 2015 was a mistake. They always look for ideal places, and that’s probably be it. I’d like to see the discussions for why they couldn’t. Plus there’s no design space that they occupy. It’s just “finish this cycle.”

Do any of you guys have experience with either Selvala, Explorer Returned or with Saffi Eriksdotter? I'd like a Selesnya deck with a cheap commander but don't know what to go for... (No, Gaddog Teeg is not an option. I have friends)
karametra can be a house
Dromoka
Karametra Enchantress
karametra mana dorks and eldrazi titans
hmmm...
Define ‘cheap’
sigarda voltron
cheap as in mana cost
i do have sigarda voltorn
voltron
rhys token vomit
new mirri... dueling
I love mirri but she looks voltrony as well. I thought both Selvala and Saffi would have unique strategies and maybe some combo potential?
i've seen selvala go infinite with untappers
Mirri tokens :stuck_out_tongue:
Mirri doesn’t have to be voltron - she’s combat control. You turn everyone else into voltron.
New Mirri is lots of fun, stay away from voltron though because it can be kinda boring.
[[nacatl war-pride]], [[glare of subdual]] and [[harvest season]] have never been more fun

text: It seems like, at worst, it's a focused Disenchant, but you have so much potential upside.
It seems a good way around enchantments with shroud, etc.
Also lots of potential downside.
only if you target something with your colors
and if you don't run a lot of enchantments, who cares?
if you don't run a lot of enchantments, might as well run Tempest of Light

text: I may not want to destroy all enchantments...
Leave No Trace just looks hard to control. there are situations where it could be a blowout and situations where it'll feel stranded in your hand
Possible, but I'm looking at it on average. There are always situations where cards can be dead in hand
I agree. I just understand the hesitation. I try to curate my deck to have as few of those instances as possible
Of course, but I might try it out in a deck. It certainly isn't for every deck...
Also seems funny in an Athreos or other god deck where you can target your own god to destroy a lot of others stuff.
I actually super dig that interaction.
Related, has anyone used [[Bonds of Mortality]]? This feels like it could be better than it looks

attachments.fallback: Bonds of Mortality {1}{G} // Enchantment // When Bonds of Mortality enters the battlefield, draw a card. // {G}: Creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
When Bonds of Mortality enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{G}: Creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.
_Jace discovered the leyline pattern needed to anchor Ulamog and Kozilek to reality, but it was Nissa who could trace it on her world._
attachments.title: Bonds of Mortality {1}{G}

text: I think about it every so, but most of the time I care about getting rid of hexproof, so the lighthouse doesn't take a spell slot.
It's okay. The fact that it replaces itself is nice. When it first came out I put it in most of my green decks, but I've slowly cut it from everything.
I find I like [[Arcane Lighthouse]] better, and I just run a more diverse removal suite to deal with indestructible things.

attachments.fallback: Arcane Lighthouse // Land // {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. // {1}, {T}: Until end of turn, creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and shroud and can't have hexproof or shroud.
attachments.text:
Land
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Until end of turn, creatures your opponents control lose hexproof and shroud and can't have hexproof or shroud.
attachments.title: Arcane Lighthouse
